sponsorship.name: Proposal for a legislative amendment to the Constitution to provide resources for education and transportation through an additional tax on incomes in excess of one million dollars
sponsorship.description: Creates a 4% surtax on income above $1 million to fund education and transportation reinvestment.

sponsorship.name: An Act providing rightful opportunities and meaningful investment for successful and equitable education
sponsorship.description: Fixes our outdated school funding formula to more accurately and equitably distribute resources – giving all schools the funding they need to deliver high-quality education.

sponsorship.name: An Act to guarantee debt-free public higher education
sponsorship.description: Creates a higher education system where every Massachusetts resident has a right to attend any public college or university free of tuition and fees.

sponsorship.name: An Act relative to affordable and accessible high quality early education and care
sponsorship.description: Makes high-quality early education and child care affordable and accessible to all Massachusetts families.

sponsorship.name: An Act establishing Medicare for All in Massachusetts
sponsorship.description: Establishes a single payer system, in which the state provides health care to all residents as a right.

sponsorship.name: An Act supporting affordable housing with a local option for a fee to be applied to certain real estate transactions
sponsorship.description: Enables cities and towns to assess a fee of 0.5-2% on residential and commercial real estate transactions, with the funds allocated to affordable housing trust funds.

sponsorship.name: An Act to protect the civil rights and safety of all Massachusetts residents
sponsorship.description: Limits local and state police collaboration with federal immigration agents, bars law enforcement and court personnel from inquiring about immigration status, and ensures due process protections.

sponsorship.name: An Act to strengthen inmate visitation
sponsorship.description: Strengthens and secures the rights of prisoners to receive visits and maintain relationships with their friends and loved ones without unnecessary interference from the state.

sponsorship.name: An Act promoting housing opportunity and mobility through eviction sealing
sponsorship.description: Requires the sealing of eviction records in order to combat housing discrimination.

sponsorship.name: An Act removing obstacles and expanding access to women's reproductive health
sponsorship.description: Reforms our state’s abortion laws so that every person can control their own body, life, and future.

sponsorship.name: An Act relative to election day registration
sponsorship.description: Eliminates the arbitrary and discriminatory 20-day registration cutoff and allows eligible residents to register or re-register--and vote--at the polls on Election Day and during the early voting period.

sponsorship.name: An Act relative to ranked choice voting
sponsorship.description: Adopts ranked choice voting for relevant elections, enabling voters to rank candidate preferences and ensuring that the ultimate winner commands a majority of support.

sponsorship.name: An Act promoting equality and respect in the legislature
sponsorship.description: Creates an independent commission to investigate and report on complaints of workplace and sexual harassment in the Massachusetts Legislature.

sponsorship.name: An Act relative to environmental justice and toxics reduction in the Commonwealth
sponsorship.description: Codifies environmental justice into law and secures strong enforcement of the state’s current EJ policy.

sponsorship.name: An Act re-powering Massachusetts with 100 percent renewable energy
sponsorship.description: Sets the goal of 100% renewable energy economy-wide by 2045 and 100% renewable electricity by 2035.

sponsorship.name: An Act to promote green infrastructure, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and create jobs
sponsorship.description: Sets a price on carbon emissions to incentivize the transition to renewable energy, with parts of the resulting revenue allocated for sustainable infrastructure.

sponsorship.name: An Act to protect the civil rights and safety of all Massachusetts residents
sponsorship.description: Limits local and state police collaboration with federal immigration agents, bars law enforcement and court personnel from inquiring about immigration status, and ensures due process protections.

sponsorship.name: An Act to strengthen inmate visitation
sponsorship.description: Strengthens and secures the rights of prisoners to receive visits and maintain relationships with their friends and loved ones without unnecessary interference from the state.

sponsorship.name: An Act promoting housing opportunity and mobility through eviction sealing
sponsorship.description: Requires the sealing of eviction records in order to combat housing discrimination.

sponsorship.name: An Act removing obstacles and expanding access to women's reproductive health
sponsorship.description: Reforms our state’s abortion laws so that every person can control their own body, life, and future.

sponsorship.name: An Act relative to election day registration
sponsorship.description: Eliminates the arbitrary and discriminatory 20-day registration cutoff and allows eligible residents to register or re-register--and vote--at the polls on Election Day and during the early voting period.

sponsorship.name: An Act relative to ranked choice voting
sponsorship.description: Adopts ranked choice voting for relevant elections, enabling voters to rank candidate preferences and ensuring that the ultimate winner commands a majority of support.

sponsorship.name: An Act promoting equality and respect in the legislature
sponsorship.description: Creates an independent commission to investigate and report on complaints of workplace and sexual harassment in the Massachusetts Legislature.

sponsorship.name: An Act relative to environmental justice and toxics reduction in the Commonwealth
sponsorship.description: Codifies environmental justice into law and secures strong enforcement of the state’s current EJ policy.

sponsorship.name: An Act re-powering Massachusetts with 100 percent renewable energy
sponsorship.description: Sets the goal of 100% renewable energy economy-wide by 2045 and 100% renewable electricity by 2035.

sponsorship.name: An Act to promote green infrastructure, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and create jobs
sponsorship.description: Sets a price on carbon emissions to incentivize the transition to renewable energy, with parts of the resulting revenue allocated for sustainable infrastructure.
